intro: Schizoglossum spurium, commonly known as the spiked orchid, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spiky inflorescence and vibrant, often purple or violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its botanical features include narrow, linear leaves and a short, sturdy stem that supports its showy blooms. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Schizoglossum spurium is considered a conservation concern.
